08/11/2024

 

 

 

Introduction
Trader Joe's has built a strong brand through unique product categories, excellent customer service, and a great shopping environment to perform well and thrive in a highly competitive retail industry (Billington & Nie, 2009). Through the analysis of Trader Joe's value chain, this paper seeks the current business gap, aiming to promote the continuous improvement of the company's profits by tapping more advanced technology.

Current value chain of Trader Joe’s
In terms of Primary Activities, for Inbound Logistics, Trader Joe's has a simple and efficient supply chain. For example, it bypasses middlemen, orders products directly from suppliers, and sells products through its store network. At the same time, Trader Joe's will place large orders in advance, giving suppliers enough time for processing and distribution (Kim et al.,2011). In operations management, fast inventory turnover while having industry-leading sales per square foot. In terms of marketing, Trader Joe's personalized the store decoration, created a fun and friendly shopping environment, and created a shopping experience of customer interest, so that customers are keen to visit the store, but also satisfied with the product consumption experience (Billington & Nie, 2009). On Outbound Logistics, Trader Joe's adopts a centralized distribution model that not only reduces costs and increases efficiency, but also enhances flexibility and increases customer satisfaction (Magee, 2021). In terms of service, Trader Joe's strives to recruit cheerful, outgoing employees to align them with the corporate culture. All employees will receive in-depth training to ensure that they can satisfy and delight customers (Yaffe-Bellany, 2020).

In terms of Support activity, Trader Joe's stores follow a highly decentralized principle, empowering store managers to use local materials and local art elements as much as possible. In addition, 80% of the products in the store are private brands, and vigorously develop star products to avoid vicious competition with other brands in the market. Trader Joe's also maintains a competitive advantage in employee benefits, such as medical insurance and pension plans, and the purchase of its products at discounted prices (Magee, 2021).



The optimized value chain of Trader Joe’s
In terms of Primary Activities, for Inbound Logistics, the current inventory management lacks real-time tracking and forecasting functions. It is suggested to adopt AI-driven supplier relationship management (SRM) systems to complete automatic replenishment according to demand and inventory to reduce waste and cost and added margin= 5-1.5= $3.5 (Grant., 2024). For operations, Robotics for stocking shelves can be used to help employees replenish shelves and improve work efficiency and added margin=6-4=$ 2 million (Tanaka et al., 2022). For outbound logistics, the distribution cost can be reduced by adopting advanced fleet management systems and planning routes with the lowest cost and added margin=3-1.3= $ 1.7 million (Efstathiadis & Silkoglou, 2015). For Marketing & Sales, AR technology can be provided online to enable customers to better understand products at home and increase their purchase intention and added margin=6-2.5=$ 3.5 million (Carmigniani et al., 2011). For Service, VR technology is used to conduct simulated scene training for employees, and customer satisfaction is improved by improving the response speed and professionalism of employees to the different needs of customers. and added margin=4-2= $ 2 million (Burdea & Coiffet, 2003).

In terms of Support Activities, for Human Resource Management, AI technology can be used to design a process suitable for enterprise recruitment and increase the possibility of recruiting suitable talents and added margin= 2.5-1=$ 1.5 million (Allal-Chérif et al., 2021).

            

Conclusion
In total, the introduction of advanced technology is expected to add $14.2million in profits to the business, enabling Trader Joe's to succeed in a highly competitive market.
